name: Louisplanets
tagline: Moving Planets from the boys and girls who code in Digital Makers at the Guild.
body:
<!--
Created using JS Bin
http://jsbin.com

Copyright (c) 2016 by anonymous (http://jsbin.com/hayayodera/1/edit)

Released under the MIT license: http://jsbin.mit-license.org
-->
<meta name="robots" content="noindex">
<script src="https://code.jquery.com/jquery-2.1.4.js"></script><script src="https://code.jquery.com/jquery-1.7.2.js"></script><svg height="600" width="600">
  <polygon points="0,0 0,600 600,600 600,0" fill="black" />

  <!-- sun -->
  <circle id="Sun" cx="300" cy="300" r="50" fill="url(#venus)" />

  <!-- mercury -->
  <circle id="Mercury" cx="300" cy="230" r="5" fill="url(#mercury)" />
  <circle cx="300" cy="300" r="70" stroke-width="1" stroke="white" fill-opacity="0.0" />

  <!-- venus -->
  <circle id="Venus" cx="300" cy="210" r="10" fill="url(#venus)" />
  <circle cx="300" cy="300" r="90" stroke-width="1" stroke="white" fill-opacity="0.0" />

  <!-- earth -->
  <circle id="Earth" cx="300" cy="180" r="10" fill="url(#earth)" />
  <circle cx="300" cy="300" r="120" stroke-width="1" stroke="white" fill-opacity="0.0" />

  <!-- mars -->
  <circle id="Mars" cx="300" cy="150" r="10" fill="url(#mars)" />
  <circle cx="300" cy="300" r="150" stroke-width="1" stroke="white" fill-opacity="0.0" />

  <!-- jupiter -->
  <circle id="Jupiter" cx="300" cy="110" r="20" fill="url(#jupiter)" />
  <circle cx="300" cy="300" r="190" stroke-width="1" stroke="white" fill-opacity="0.0" />

  <!-- saturn -->
  <circle id="Saturn" cx="300" cy="60" r="15" fill="url(#saturn)" />
  <circle id="SaturnRing" cx="300" cy="60" r="25" stroke-width="1" stroke="white" fill-opacity="0.0" />
 <circle cx="300" cy="300" r="240" stroke-width="1" stroke="white" fill-opacity="0.0" />

  <linearGradient id="earth" x1="0%" y1="0%" x2="100%" y2="0%">
    <stop offset="0%" stop-color="#00ff00" />
    <stop offset="100%" stop-color="#0000ff" />
  </linearGradient>

  <linearGradient id="mercury" x1="0%" y1="0%" x2="100%" y2="0%">
    <stop offset="0%" stop-color="#b0b0b0" />
    <stop offset="100%" stop-color="#ffffff" />
  </linearGradient>

  <linearGradient id="venus" x1="0%" y1="0%" x2="100%" y2="0%">
    <stop offset="0%" stop-color="#ff0000" />
    <stop offset="100%" stop-color="#fff000" />
  </linearGradient>

  <linearGradient id="mars" x1="0%" y1="0%" x2="100%" y2="0%">
    <stop offset="0%" stop-color="#ff0000" />
    <stop offset="100%" stop-color="#fff00" />
  </linearGradient>

  <linearGradient id="jupiter" x1="0%" y1="0%" x2="100%" y2="0%">
    <stop offset="0%" stop-color="#ff0000" />
    <stop offset="100%" stop-color="#fff00" />
  </linearGradient>

  <linearGradient id="saturn" x1="0%" y1="0%" x2="100%" y2="0%">
    <stop offset="0%" stop-color="#fdff86" />
    <stop offset="100%" stop-color="#fff000" />
  </linearGradient>

  <linearGradient id="sun" x1="0%" y1="0%" x2="100%" y2="0%">
    <stop offset="0%" stop-color="#fff00f" />
    <stop offset="100%" stop-color="#fff000" />
  </linearGradient>
</svg>

<script id="jsbin-javascript">
var venus = 0;
var mercury = 0;
var earth = 0;
var mars = 0;
var jupiter = 0;
var saturn = 0;

var SunIsOff = true;

function movePlanets() {
  mercury = mercury + 0.04 * 365 /88;
    venus = venus + 0.04 * 365 /244;
      earth = earth + 0.04 * 365/365;
        mars = mars + 0.04 * 365 / 687;
          jupiter = jupiter + 0.04 * 365 / 4329;
            saturn = saturn + 0.004 * 365 / 10832;

  var mercuryX = calculateXPosition(mercury, 300, 70);
  var mercuryY = calculateYPosition(mercury, 300, 70);
  console.log("Mercury x=" + mercuryX + " y = " + mercuryY);

  var venusX = calculateXPosition(venus, 300, 90);
  var venusY = calculateYPosition(venus, 300, 90);
  console.log("Venus x=" + venusX + " y = " + venusY);
  
  var earthX = calculateXPosition(earth, 300, 120);
  var earthY = calculateYPosition(earth, 300, 120);
  console.log("earth x=" + earthX + " y = " + earthY);
  
  var marsX = calculateXPosition(mars, 300, 150);
  var marsY = calculateYPosition(mars, 300, 150);
  console.log("Mars x=" + marsX + " y = " + marsY);
  
  var jupiterX = calculateXPosition(jupiter, 300, 190);
  var jupiterY = calculateYPosition(jupiter, 300, 190);
  console.log("Jupiter x=" + jupiterX + " y = " + jupiterY);
 
  var saturnX = calculateXPosition(saturn, 300, 240);
  var saturnY = calculateYPosition(saturn, 300, 240);
  console.log("saturn x=" + saturnX + " y = " + saturnY);
  
  var SaturnRingX = calculateXPosition(saturn, 300, 240);
  var SaturnRingY = calculateYPosition(saturn, 300, 240);
  console.log("saturnring x=" + SaturnRingX + " y = " + SaturnRingY);
  
  $("#Mercury").attr("cx", mercuryX);
$("#Mercury").attr("cy", mercuryY);

 $("#Venus").attr("cx", venusX);
$("#Venus").attr("cy", venusY);

  $("#Earth").attr("cx", earthX);
$("#Earth").attr("cy", earthY);

 $("#Mars").attr("cx", marsX);
$("#Mars").attr("cy", marsY);

 $("#Jupiter").attr("cx", jupiterX);
$("#Jupiter").attr("cy", jupiterY);

 $("#Saturn").attr("cx", saturnX);
$("#Saturn").attr("cy", saturnY);

 $("#SaturnRing").attr("cx", SaturnRingX);
$("#SaturnRing").attr("cy", SaturnRingY);

}

function calculateXPosition(degrees, sunX, orbitRadius) {
  var velocity = degrees * (Math.PI / 180);
  return sunX + (orbitRadius * Math.cos(velocity));
}

function calculateYPosition(degrees, sunY, orbitRadius) {
  var velocity = degrees * (Math.PI / 180);
  return sunY + (orbitRadius * Math.sin(velocity));
}

setInterval(movePlanets, 2.5);

</script>
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
